trans-unit.source: Running a fast network between the primary and secondary hosts, and keeping it full throttle for DRBD transfers, will go a long way to mitigating the any damage that may be done in the event of a loss of the primary from an un-synced cluster.
trans-unit.target: 在主要主机和次要主机之间运行一个快速网络,并保持全节流进行DRBD传输,这将在很大程度上减轻在未同步集群丢失主要主机的情况下可能造成的任何损害。

trans-unit.source: Runtime dependencies for your package. These dependencies are processed by Chef Habitat and their corresponding environment variables (such as PATH and LD_LIBRARY_PATH) are added to the current environment.
trans-unit.target: 程序包的运行时依赖项。这些依赖关系由Chef Habitat处理，并将它们的相应环境变量（例如 PATH 和 LD_LIBRARY_PATH ）添加到当前环境中。

trans-unit.source: Runtime environments of dependencies are layered together in the order they are declared in your pkg_deps array, followed by modifications made in this callback. In turn, these computed values will be made available to packages that use the current package as a dependency, and so on.
trans-unit.target: 依赖项的运行时环境按照它们在 pkg_deps 数组中声明的顺序分层放置，然后在此回调中进行修改。反过来，这些计算值将提供给使用当前程序包作为依赖项的程序包，依此类推。

trans-unit.source: SGs are a networking construct which contain ingress and egress rules for network communications. SGs may be attached to EC2 instances, as well as certain other AWS resources. Along with Network Access Control Lists, SGs are one of the two main mechanisms of enforcing network-level security.
trans-unit.target: SG是一种网络结构,其中包含网络通信的入口和出口规则。SG可以附加到EC2实例以及某些其他AWS资源。与网络访问控制列表一起,SG是强制执行网络级安全的两个主要机制之一。

trans-unit.source: SSL certificates from an on-premises Chef Infra Server can be copied to the /trusted_certs_dir directory on your local workstation automatically by running knife ssl fetch. These certificates are used during knife operations to communicate with the Chef Infra Server.
trans-unit.target: 通过运行knife ssl fetch，可以自动将来自本地Chef Infra Server的SSL证书复制到本地工作站上的 /trusted_certs_dir 目录。这些证书在 knife 操作期间用于与Chef Infra Server通信。

trans-unit.source: SSL certificates from an on-premises Chef Infra Server can be copied to the /trusted_certs_dir directory on your local workstation automatically by running knife ssl fetch. These certificates are used during knife operations to communicate with the Chef Infra Server.

trans-unit.source: SSL certificates should be regenerated periodically. This is an important part of protecting the Chef Infra Server from vulnerabilities and helps to prevent the information stored on the Chef Infra Server from being compromised.
trans-unit.target: SSL证书应该定期重新生成。这是保护Chef Infra服务器不受漏洞影响的重要部分,有助于防止存储在Chef Infra服务器上的信息被泄露。

trans-unit.source: Save the config.yaml file to the /files directory of your Chef Desktop cookbook. Configuring the app resource in the Windows recipe file deploys the config.yaml setting to your Windows 10 desktops. The next time Gorilla checks in with your CDN, it pull down the manifest, parses the applications and catalog listings for loading, and finally loads the applications by first loading the catalog(s) and then attempting to load the apps from the catalog(s). To see this in action, use gorilla -d from the command line to get the debug output.
trans-unit.target: 将 config.yaml 文件保存到Chef Desktop食谱的 /files 目录中。在Windows配方文件中配置应用程序资源 config.yaml 设置部署到Windows 10桌面。下次Gorilla使用CDN进行检入时，它将下拉清单，分析要加载的应用程序和目录列表，最后通过首先加载目录，然后尝试从目录中加载应用程序来加载应用程序。 ）。要查看实际效果，请从命令行使用 gorilla -d 获取调试输出。

trans-unit.source: Search indexes allow queries to be made for any type of data that is indexed by the Chef Infra Server, including data bags (and data bag items), environments, nodes, and roles. A defined query syntax is used to support search patterns like exact, wildcard, range, and fuzzy. A search is a full-text query that can be done from several locations, including from within a recipe, by using the search subcommand in knife, the search method in the Recipe DSL, the search box in the Chef management console, and by using the /search or /search/INDEX endpoints in the Chef Infra Server API. The search engine is based on Elasticsearch and is run from the Chef Infra Server.
trans-unit.target: 搜索索引允许查询由Chef Infra Server索引的任何类型的数据，包括数据袋（和数据袋项目），环境，节点和角色。定义的查询语法用于支持精确，通配符，范围和模糊等搜索模式。搜索是一种全文查询，可以从多个位置进行查询，包括在配方中，通过使用刀中的 search 子命令，配方DSL中的 search 方法，Chef管理控制台中的搜索框以及Chef Infra Server API中的 /search 或 /search/INDEX 端点。搜索引擎基于Elasticsearch，并从Chef Infra Server运行。

trans-unit.source: Search indexes allow queries to be made for any type of data that is indexed by the Chef server, including data bags (and data bag items), environments, nodes, and roles. A defined query syntax is used to support search patterns like exact, wildcard, range, and fuzzy. A search is a full-text query that can be done from several locations, including from within a recipe, by using the search subcommand in knife, the search method in the Recipe DSL, the search box in the Chef management console, and by using the /search or /search/INDEX endpoints in the Chef server API. The search engine is based on Apache Solr and is run from the Chef server.
trans-unit.target: 搜索索引允许查询由Chef服务器索引的任何类型的数据，包括数据袋（和数据袋项目），环境，节点和角色。定义的查询语法用于支持精确，通配符，范围和模糊等搜索模式。搜索是一种全文查询，可以从多个位置进行查询，包括在配方中，通过使用刀中的 search 子命令，配方DSL中的 search 方法，Chef管理控制台中的搜索框以及通过使用Chef服务器API中的 /search 或 /search/INDEX 端点。搜索引擎基于Apache Solr，并从Chef服务器运行。

trans-unit.source: Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) is an XML-based, open-standard data format for exchanging authentication and authorization data between parties, in particular, between an identity provider and a service provider. Chef Automate supports SAML-backed Single Sign On (SSO) as a service provider, integrating with your chosen identity provider.
trans-unit.target: 安全断言标记语言(SAML)是一种基于XML的开放标准数据格式,用于在各方之间,特别是身份提供商和服务提供商之间交换认证和授权数据。Chef Automate支持SAML支持的单点登录(SSO)作为服务提供商,与您选择的身份提供商集成。

trans-unit.source: Security Center Policies are defined for each Resource Group. A Security Center Policy called default also exists for every subscription.
trans-unit.target: 为每个资源组定义了安全中心策略。每个订阅都还存在一个称为“ default 安全中心策略。

trans-unit.source: Security groups are a networking construct that contain ingress and egress rules for network communications. Security groups may be attached to EC2 instances, as well as certain other AWS resources. Along with Network Access Control Lists, Security Groups are one of the two main mechanisms of enforcing network-level security.
trans-unit.target: 安全组是一种网络结构,包含网络通信的入口和出口规则。安全组可以附加到EC2实例以及某些其他AWS资源。与网络访问控制列表一起,安全组是执行网络级安全的两个主要机制之一。

trans-unit.source: Select only files that have been added (A), deleted (D), modified (M), and/or have had their type changed (T). Any combination of filter characters may be used, including no filter characters. Use * to select all paths if a file matches other criteria in the comparison. Default value: nil.
trans-unit.target: 仅选择已添加（ A ），已删除（ D ），已修改（ M ）和/或类型已更改（ T ）的文件。可以使用过滤器字符的任何组合，不包括过滤器字符。如果文件与比较中的其他条件匹配，请使用 * 选择所有路径。默认值： nil 。

trans-unit.source: Select the (…) icon to display a menu with two additional options: Add Filter and Scan Results. Use Add Filter to narrow the results to the id of the selected profile. Use Scan Results to show the scan results of controls for the specific node in a side window.

trans-unit.source: Serverspec
trans-unit.target: Serverspec

trans-unit.source: Serverspec and RSpec allow you to define nested describe blocks. We did a survey and found out that most users use nested describe blocks only to improve their output report. We believe the code structure should not change to improve the output of a report. Nevertheless we understand that nested describe blocks help you to structure test code. A sample code block looks like:
trans-unit.target: Serverspec和RSpec允许你定义嵌套的描述块。我们做了一个调查,发现大多数用户使用嵌套描述块只是为了改善他们的输出报表。我们认为不应该为了改善报表的输出而改变代码结构。尽管如此,我们理解嵌套描述块可以帮助您构建测试代码。一个示例代码块是这样的。

trans-unit.source: Serverspec is the first extension of RSpec that enabled users to run RSpec tests on servers to verify deployed artifacts. It was created in March 2013 by Gosuke Miyashita and has been widely adopted. It is also one of the core test frameworks within test-kitchen and has been widely used within the Chef ecosystem. Chef InSpec takes lessons learned implementing and using Serverspec and builds on them to make auditing and compliance easier.
trans-unit.target: Serverspec是RSpec的第一个扩展,它使用户能够在服务器上运行RSpec测试以验证部署的工件。它于2013年3月由Gosuke Miyashita创建,并已被广泛采用。它也是test-kitchen中的核心测试框架之一,并在Chef生态系统中得到了广泛的应用。Chef InSpec吸取了实施和使用Serverspec的经验教训,并在此基础上使审计和合规性更容易。

trans-unit.source: Service groups are Chef Habitat services, which Chef Automate orders by package identifiers and configurations. The Applications dashboard Service Groups display gives you a top-level view of your Chef Habitat services groups and lets you drill down into the status of individual instances to understand the health and contentents of any individual instance of a service. The default Service Groups view shows only the services that are available. The right sidebar provides detailed reporting for each individual service.

trans-unit.source: Services grouped using a leader need to have a minimum of three supervisors in order to break ties. It is also strongly recommended that you do not run the service group with an even number of members. Otherwise, in the event of a network partition with equal members on each side, both sides will elect a new leader, causing a full split-brain from which the algorithm cannot recover. Supervisors in a service group will warn you if you are using leader election and have an even number of supervisors.
trans-unit.target: 使用组长的服务组需要至少有三个主管,才能打破束缚。同时强烈建议不要运行成员数为偶数的服务组。否则,在网络分区时,如果双方成员数相等,双方会选出一个新的领导者,造成完全分脑,算法无法从中恢复。如果你使用的是领袖选举,且监督员人数为偶数,服务组中的监督员会警告你。

trans-unit.source: Session affinity option. Must be one of these values: - NONE: Connections from the same client IP may go to any instance in the pool. - CLIENT_IP: Connections from the same client IP will go to the same instance in the pool while that instance remains healthy. - CLIENT_IP_PROTO: Connections from the same client IP with the same IP protocol will go to the same instance in the pool while that instance remains healthy.
trans-unit.target: 会话亲和力选项。必须是这些值之一。-NONE:来自同一客户端IP的连接可能会转到池中的任何实例。-CLIENT_IP:来自同一客户端 IP 的连接将转到池中的同一实例,同时该实例保持健康。 来自同一客户端IP的相同IP协议的连接将转到池中的同一实例,同时该实例保持健康。

trans-unit.source: Set up Chef Automate to detect and monitor the nodes in your AWS EC2 and Azure accounts by providing your credentials and creating a node manager. Chef Automate creates a node reference for each instance in your account. Associate your EC2 and Azure instances with ssh and WinRM credentials using tags–the values support wildcard matching–in your node manager. Run scan jobs with your node manager reference and you’re suddenly running an inspec exec across your instances. Every two hours Chef Automate queries your AWS or Azure account to see the current state of all your nodes to determine if they are running, stopped, or terminated, and then updates Chef Automate accordingly. If the node manager finds an instance that used to be running and reachable but which no longer is (the node stopped, terminated, or is in a transition state), the node manager updates the status of that node in Chef Automate accordingly.
trans-unit.target: 通过提供您的凭证并创建节点管理器，来设置Chef Automate以检测和监视AWS EC2和Azure账户中的节点。 Chef Automate为您帐户中的每个实例创建一个节点引用。在节点管理器中使用标签（值支持通配符匹配）将EC2和Azure实例与ssh和WinRM凭据关联。使用节点管理器参考来运行扫描作业，然后突然运行了一个 inspec exec 在您的实例中。每隔两个小时，Chef Automate会查询您的AWS或Azure帐户以查看所有节点的当前状态，以确定它们是否正在运行，停止或终止，然后相应地更新Chef Automate。如果节点管理器找到一个曾经运行且可访问但不再存在的实例（该节点已停止，终止或处于过渡状态），则节点管理器会在Chef Automate中相应地更新该节点的状态。

trans-unit.source: Set up Chef Automate to detect and monitor the nodes in your AWS EC2 and Azure accounts by providing your credentials in the Node Credentials page in the Settings tab and creating a node manager. Chef Automate creates a node reference for each instance in your account. Associate your EC2 and Azure instances with ssh and WinRM credentials using tags–the values support wildcard match–in your node manager. Run scan jobs with your node manager reference and you’re suddenly running an inspec exec across your instances. Every two hours Chef Automate queries your AWS or Azure account to see the current state of all your nodes, if they are running, stopped, or terminated, and then updates Chef Automate accordingly. If the node manager finds an instance that used to be running and reachable, but which no is–if the node is stopped, terminated, or a transition state–it updates the status of that node in Chef Automate accordingly.
trans-unit.target: 通过在“设置”选项卡的“节点凭据”页面中提供凭据并创建节点管理器，来设置Chef Automate，以检测和监视AWS EC2和Azure账户中的节点。 Chef Automate为您帐户中的每个实例创建一个节点引用。在节点管理器中使用标签（值支持通配符匹配）将EC2和Azure实例与ssh和WinRM凭据关联。使用节点管理器参考来运行扫描作业，然后突然运行了一个 inspec exec 在您的实例中。每隔两个小时，Chef Automate会查询您的AWS或Azure帐户以查看所有节点的当前状态（如果它们正在运行，停止或终止），然后相应地更新Chef Automate。如果节点管理器找到一个曾经运行且可访问的实例，但没有（如果该节点已停止，终止或处于过渡状态），则它将在Chef Automate中相应地更新该节点的状态。

trans-unit.source: Set up Chef Automate to detect and scan the nodes in your AWS EC2 account by providing your AWS Credentials and creating an AWS EC2 Node Manager from the Node Credentials page in the Settings tab. Chef Automate requires your information to detect the nodes in your AWS EC2 account. Chef Automate creates a node reference for each EC2 instance in your account and collects all of the tags associated with each instance.
trans-unit.target: 通过提供您的AWS凭证并从“设置”选项卡的“节点凭证”页面中创建一个AWS EC2节点管理器，来设置Chef Automate以检测和扫描您的AWS EC2帐户中的节点。 Chef Automate要求您提供信息来检测AWS EC2帐户中的节点。 Chef Automate为您帐户中的每个EC2实例创建一个节点引用，并收集与每个实例关联的所有标签。

trans-unit.source: Set up Chef Automate to detect and scan the nodes in your Azure account by providing your Azure Credentials and creating an Azure VM Node Manager. To add an Azure VM Node Manager, navigate to the Node Integrations page in the Settings tab, select Create Integration, and you should see Azure as one of your node management service options.
trans-unit.target: 通过提供您的Azure凭据并创建一个Azure VM节点管理器，设置Chef Automate来检测和扫描Azure帐户中的节点。若要添加Azure VM节点管理器，请导航到“设置”选项卡中的“节点集成”页面，选择“ Create Integration ，您应该将Azure视为节点管理服务选项之一。

trans-unit.source: Setting RUST_LOG to one of these values will cause all log messages at that verbosity and below (equivalently, that severity and above) to be printed. This includes log messages from Habitat, as well as any libraries that it uses.

trans-unit.source: Setting allowed_groups provides SAML sign in to members of the listed groups. All of the other user groups that are not in the list are discarded, and not available to Chef Automate. In the configuration example above, only users in either “group1” or “group2” may sign in, and those groups would appear as team:saml:group1 and team:saml:group2 respectively.
trans-unit.target: 设置 allowed_groups 可以使SAML登录到列出的组的成员。不在列表中的所有其他用户组将被丢弃，并且不适用于Chef Automate。在上面的配置示例中，只有“ group1”或“ group2”中的用户可以登录，并且这些组分别显示为 team:saml:group1 和 team:saml:group2 。

trans-unit.source: Setting updated_by_last_action is almost always unnecessary, and correct use of use_inline_resources (which is the default in Chef Client 13 and above) makes the updated_by_last_action setting redundant. Simply deleting this code is very likely to be the correct course of action in nearly all cases.
trans-unit.target: 几乎总是不需要设置 updated_by_last_action ，正确使用 use_inline_resources （Chef Client 13及更高版本中的默认设置）会使 updated_by_last_action 设置变得多余。几乎在所有情况下，简单地删除此代码都是正确的做法。

trans-unit.source: Setting node attributes with set or set_unless has been deprecated in favor of explicitly setting the precedence level. These methods will be removed in Chef Client 14.
trans-unit.target: 不建议使用 set 或 set_unless 设置节点属性，而应明确设置优先级。这些方法将在Chef Client 14中删除。

trans-unit.source: Setting the LC_ALL variable is NOT recommended. As a system-wide setting, LANG should provide the desired behavior. LC_ALL is intended to be used for temporarily troubleshooting issues rather than an everyday system setting. Changing LC_ALL can break Chef’s parsing of command output in unexpected ways. Use one of the more specific LC_ properties as needed. This deprecation warning was added in Chef Infra Client 15.0. Support for property lc_all will be removed for Chef Infra Client 16.0.
trans-unit.target: 不建议设置 LC_ALL 变量。作为系统范围的设置， LANG 应该提供所需的行为。 LC_ALL 用于临时解决问题，而不是用于日常系统设置。更改 LC_ALL 可能会以意想不到的方式破坏Chef对命令输出的解析。根据需要使用更具体的 LC_ 属性之一。此弃用警告已添加到Chef Infra Client 15.0中。Chef Infra Client 16.0将删除对属性 lc_all 的支持。

trans-unit.source: Setting the project rule Resource Type determines what condition attributes are available to select. Event rule conditions can only have the attributes Chef Organization or Chef Server.
trans-unit.target: 设置项目规则 Resource Type 决定了哪些条件属性可供选择。 Event 规则条件只能具有“ Chef Organization 或“ Chef Server ”属性。

trans-unit.source: Setting the value to cookbook creates an incident for the failed cookbook. All failing Chef Infra Client runs on nodes are associated with the corresponding incident. cookbook is the default value because the number of nodes is likely to exceed the number of cookbooks. The short description of the incident will indicate the failed cookbook:
trans-unit.target: 将值设置为 cookbook 会为失败的Cookbook创建事件。在节点上运行的所有失败的Chef Infra Client都与相应的事件关联。 cookbook 是默认值，因为节点数可能会超过Cookbook的数量。对事件的简短描述将指示失败的食谱：

trans-unit.source: Setting the value to node creates an incident for each failed node. All InSpec scans failing for a node will be associated with the corresponding incident.
trans-unit.target: 将值设置为 node 会为每个失败的节点创建一个事件。所有失败的InSpec扫描都将与相应的事件相关联。

trans-unit.source: Setting the value to node creates an incident for each failed node. All failing Chef Infra Client runs for a node are associated with the corresponding incident. The short description of the incident will indicate the failed node:
trans-unit.target: 将值设置为 node 会为每个失败的节点创建一个事件。节点运行的所有失败的Chef Infra Client运行都与相应的事件关联。对事件的简短描述将指示发生故障的节点：

trans-unit.source: Setting the value to profile creates an incident for the failed InSpec compliance profile. All InSpec scans on failing nodes will be associated with the corresponding incident. profile is the default value because the number of nodes is likely to exceed the number of profiles.
trans-unit.target: 将该值设置为 profile 会为失败的InSpec合规性配置文件创建事件。发生故障的节点上的所有InSpec扫描都将与相应的事件关联。 profile 是默认值，因为节点数可能会超过配置文件数。

trans-unit.source: Setting these environment variables before the initial deployment of Chef Automate adds them to the configuration that Chef Automate generates.
trans-unit.target: 在初始部署Chef Automate之前设置这些环境变量,将它们添加到Chef Automate生成的配置中。

trans-unit.source: Setting this audit policy option to true will cause the system to crash if the auditing system is unable to log events.
trans-unit.target: 将该审计策略选项设置为 "true",如果审计系统无法记录事件,将导致系统崩溃。

trans-unit.source: Setting this audit policy option to true will force the audit of all privilege changes except SeAuditPrivilege. Setting this property may cause the logs to fill up more quickly.
trans-unit.target: 将此审计策略选项设置为 "true "将强制审计除SeAuditPrivilege以外的所有权限更改。设置此属性可能会导致日志填得更快。

trans-unit.source: Setting this audit policy option to true will force the system to assign a System Access Control List to named objects to enable auditing of base objects such as mutexes.
trans-unit.target: 将此审计策略选项设置为 "true",将强制系统为命名对象分配系统访问控制列表,以实现对基础对象(如mutexes)的审计。

trans-unit.source: Setting this audit policy option to true will force the system to assign a System Access Control List to named objects to enable auditing of container objects such as directories.
trans-unit.target: 将此审计策略选项设置为 "true",将强制系统为命名对象分配系统访问控制列表,以实现对容器对象(如目录)的审计。

trans-unit.source: Setting this to true allows clients to request inclusion of entire hierarchy in the response payload. Note that expand: 'children' must be passed up if recurse is set to true.
trans-unit.target: 将此设置为true允许客户端请求将整个层次结构包含在响应有效负载中。请注意，如果 recurse 设置为 true ，则必须传递 expand: 'children' 。

trans-unit.source: Should the resource overwrite the destination file contents if they already exist? If set to :auto the date stamp of files within the archive will be compared to those on disk and disk contents will be overwritten if they differ. This may cause unintended consequences if disk date stamps are changed between runs, which will result in the files being overwritten during each client run. Make sure to properly test any change to this property.
trans-unit.target: 资源是否应覆盖目标文件内容（如果已存在）？如果设置为 :auto ，则会将存档中文件的日期戳记与磁盘上的日期戳进行比较，如果磁盘内容不同，则磁盘内容将被覆盖。如果在运行之间更改磁盘日期戳，可能会导致意外的后果，这将导致在每次客户端运行期间覆盖文件。确保正确测试对此属性的任何更改。

trans-unit.source: Show that a cookbook has a dependency on another cookbook. Use a version constraint to define dependencies for cookbook versions: < (less than), <= (less than or equal to), = (equal to), >= (greater than or equal to; also known as "optimistically greater than", or "optimistic"), ~> (approximately greater than; also known as "pessimistically greater than", or "pessimistic"), or > (greater than). This field requires that a cookbook with a matching name and version exists on the Chef Infra Server. When the match exists, the Chef Infra Server includes the dependency as part of the set of cookbooks that are sent to the node when Chef Infra Client runs. It is very important that the depends field contain accurate data. If a dependency statement is inaccurate, Chef Infra Client may not be able to complete the configuration of the system. For example:
trans-unit.target: 证明一本食谱依赖于另一本食谱。使用版本约束来定义食谱版本的依赖关系： < （小于）， <= （小于或等于）， = （等于）， >= （大于或等于；也称为“大于”） ，或“乐观”）， ~> （大约大于；也称为“悲观大于”或“悲观”）或 > （大于）。该字段要求Chef Infra Server上存在具有匹配名称和版本的食谱。当存在匹配项时，Chef Infra Server会将依赖项包含为Chef Infra Client运行时发送到节点的食谱集的一部分。重要的是 depends 字段包含准确的数据。如果依赖项声明不正确，Chef Infra Client可能无法完成系统的配置。例如：

trans-unit.source: Show that a cookbook has a dependency on another cookbook. Use a version constraint to define dependencies for cookbook versions: < (less than), <= (less than or equal to), = (equal to), >= (greater than or equal to; also known as “optimistically greater than”, or “optimistic”), ~> (approximately greater than; also known as “pessimistically greater than”, or “pessimistic”), or > (greater than). This field requires that a cookbook with a matching name and version exists on the Chef server. When the match exists, the Chef server includes the dependency as part of the set of cookbooks that are sent to the node when the chef-client runs. It is very important that the depends field contain accurate data. If a dependency statement is inaccurate, the chef-client may not be able to complete the configuration of the system.
trans-unit.target: 证明一本食谱依赖于另一本食谱。使用版本约束来定义菜谱版本的依赖关系： < （小于）， <= （小于或等于）， = （等于）， >= （大于或等于；也称为“大于”） ，或“乐观”）， ~> （大约大于；也称为“悲观大于”或“悲观”）或 > （大于）。此字段要求Chef服务器上存在具有匹配名称和版本的食谱。当存在匹配项时，Chef服务器将依赖项作为厨师簿集合的一部分包含在内，该食谱在厨师客户机运行时发送到节点。重要的是 depends 字段包含准确的数据。如果依赖项声明不正确，则厨师客户端可能无法完成系统的配置。

trans-unit.source: Show that a cookbook has a dependency on another cookbook. This field requires that a cookbook with a matching name and version exists on the Chef server. When the match exists, the Chef server includes the dependency as part of the set of cookbooks that are sent to the node when the chef-client runs. trans-unit.source: Show that a cookbook has a supported platform. Use a version constraint to define dependencies for platform versions: < (less than), <= (less than or equal to), = (equal to), >= (greater than or equal to), ~> (approximately greater than), or > (greater than). To specify more than one platform, use more than one supports field, once for each platform.
trans-unit.target: 显示食谱具有受支持的平台。使用版本约束来定义平台版本的依存关系： < （小于）， <= （小于或等于）， = （等于）， >= （大于或等于）， ~> （大约大于）或 > （大于）。要指定多个平台，请使用多个 supports 字段，每个平台一次。
